Package Brewmaster

Class TemperatureHandler

java.lang.Object
Brewmaster.TemperatureHandler
public class TemperatureHandler
extends java.lang.Object

TemperatureHandler

The PowerSocket class is used to control a wireless relay
Since:
2020-23-9

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TemperatureHandler​(Settings settings)
    Sets up based on Settings the logFile, heater if hasHeater is true, cooler, runs logDaily()

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void checkTemp()
    Checks if temperature currentTemp is in the acceptable range of Settings.tempErrorMarginPlus and Settings.tempErrorMarginMinus if Settings.hasHeater is true and PowerSocket.waitBetweenPowerSwitch() is false and it's to cold it will turn on heater by calling PowerSocket.turnOn() or turn off heater by calling PowerSocket.turnOff() if it's too hot.
    private java.lang.String findFolderNameOfProbe​(java.lang.String[] str)
    Tries to find folder path in "/sys/bus/w1/devices/" starting with 28 and return it, if not found system will exit with status 1
    protected double getCurrentTemp()
    Getter for currentTemp
    protected int getDaysLastCheck()
    Getter for daysLastCheck
    protected java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getLogList()  
    protected double getMaxTemp()
    Getter for maxTemp
    protected double getMinTemp()
    Getter for minTemp
    protected java.lang.String getState()
    Getter for state
    private void log​(java.lang.String log)
    Tries to add String log to logFile
    private void logDaily()
    Tries to add daysLastCheck+1 (adding 1 to start with day 1 instead of day 0) and the Settings.dailyState and Settings.dailyTemp for index daysLastCheck (the current day) to logFile
    protected void logTemp()
    Tries to add the current value from PowerSocket.on of the heater if Settings.hasHeater and the current value from PowerSocket.on of the cooler and TempDateTime.getFormatedDateTimeTemp() to logFile adds log to logList, removes first if logList is larger than 23
    protected void run()
    Runs updateTemp(), checkTemp(), updateDay() and logTemp()
    private void updateDay()
    When first run it initializes tomorrow as the current time and adds secondsInADay and a Instant now as the current time.
    private void updateTemp()
    Reads the temperature probe text file named w1_slave to get temperature and store in currentTemp, updates maxTemp and minTemp
    private java.lang.Boolean waitBetweenLogging()
    Returns a Boolean that is false if the time since you last called the method is greater than than specified by the settings

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • updateTemp

      private void updateTemp()
      Reads the temperature probe text file named w1_slave to get temperature and store in currentTemp, updates maxTemp and minTemp
      See Also:
      findFolderNameOfProbe(java.lang.String[]), currentTemp, maxTemp, minTemp

    • findFolderNameOfProbe

      private java.lang.String findFolderNameOfProbe​(java.lang.String[] str)
      Tries to find folder path in "/sys/bus/w1/devices/" starting with 28 and return it, if not found system will exit with status 1
      Parameters:
      str - String array containing folder paths in "/sys/bus/w1/devices/"
      Returns:
      String path of the folder that is starts with "28"
      See Also:
      updateTemp()

    • checkTemp

      private void checkTemp()
      Checks if temperature currentTemp is in the acceptable range of Settings.tempErrorMarginPlus and Settings.tempErrorMarginMinus if Settings.hasHeater is true and PowerSocket.waitBetweenPowerSwitch() is false and it's to cold it will turn on heater by calling PowerSocket.turnOn() or turn off heater by calling PowerSocket.turnOff() if it's too hot. if PowerSocket.waitBetweenPowerSwitch() is false and it's too cold it will turn off the cooler by calling PowerSocket.turnOff() or turn off the cooler by calling PowerSocket.turnOff() if it's too hot.
      See Also:
      currentTemp, Settings, PowerSocket.waitBetweenPowerSwitch(), heater, cooler, PowerSocket.turnOff(), PowerSocket.turnOn(), daysLastCheck, Settings.hasHeater, Settings.tempErrorMarginMinus, Settings.tempErrorMarginPlus

    • updateDay

      private void updateDay()
      When first run it initializes tomorrow as the current time and adds secondsInADay and a Instant now as the current time. the next times the method is ran it will check if the time past since tomorrow has exceeded 24 hours. If it has it will set tomorrow as the current time plus 24 hours and add 1 to daysLastCheck to signify that a day has past. If daysLastCheck is greater or equal than the size of Settings.dailyTemp the program will terminate with status 0, the program has finished. If it's not greater it will call logDaily()
      See Also:
      daysLastCheck, Settings.dailyTemp, logDaily()

    • waitBetweenLogging

      private java.lang.Boolean waitBetweenLogging()
      Returns a Boolean that is false if the time since you last called the method is greater than than specified by the settings
      Returns:
      a Boolean that is false if the time since you last called the method is greater than than specified by the settings
      See Also:
      lastInstant, Settings.minutesToWaitLog

    • log

      private void log​(java.lang.String log)
      Tries to add String log to logFile
      Parameters:
      log - String to add to log file
      See Also:
      lastInstant, logFile

    • logDaily

      private void logDaily()
      Tries to add daysLastCheck+1 (adding 1 to start with day 1 instead of day 0) and the Settings.dailyState and Settings.dailyTemp for index daysLastCheck (the current day) to logFile
      See Also:
      daysLastCheck, Settings.dailyTemp, Settings.dailyTemp, logFile

    • getLogList

      protected java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getLogList()
      Returns:
      #logList

    • logTemp

      protected void logTemp()
      Tries to add the current value from PowerSocket.on of the heater if Settings.hasHeater and the current value from PowerSocket.on of the cooler and TempDateTime.getFormatedDateTimeTemp() to logFile adds log to logList, removes first if logList is larger than 23
      See Also:
      currentTemp, cooler, heater, logFile, logList, TempDateTime, Settings.hasHeater, PowerSocket.on
